title: About
text:
The use of software is generally a necessary, or even primary, component of research in statistics, but often statistically trained individuals are not well equipped or trained deeply on computer science, programming principles or even with handling real data. The main idea of this study group is to be greater than the sum of its parts, that is, rather than learning in isolation, we share knowledge and accelerate our learning – hopefully all while having fun!
The overarching aim of this study group is to foster an environment for Monash EBS students to get feedback and ideas from those outside their usual mentoring network (usually their supervisors) on matters related to data science research software, facilitate peer mentoring and network. The students get an opportunity to present their work concisely (getting the practice they need), teach concepts they learnt and/or learn from others.

title: About
text:
Code of conduct
Use common sense - be kind and respectful. Criticism should be constructive and designed to improve a student’s work.

title: Package Design Feedback session 2
text: 15+15 mins Presentation + Discussion

title: Package Design Feedback session 2
text: 15+15 mins Presentation + Discussion

title: Package Design Feedback session 2
text:
Details
Explain a software design/engineering problem you are facing in your current package work. Slides optional. Suggested presentation structure:

Package Context (1-2 mins): Background, motivation, target user, features etc.
Development Challenge(s) (5-7 mins): Outline the specific problem/idea you want feedback

title: Package Design Feedback session 2
text:

Kris - animbook https://github.com/KrisanatA/animbook
Patrick - autovi
Fin - pindex

title: Quarto Craft session

Details
Show off some cool things you’ve done with quarto, share a strong opinion about quarto, or ask for help with quarto problems

title: Quarto Craft session
text:
Speakers

Michael - Quarto productivity in VSCode

Snippets; keybindins or palette
Michael’s Shippets

https://gist.github.com/MikeLydeamore/60bdaa80a746215d593f99d52d7df083

shrtcts for RStudio

https://github.com/gadenbuie/shrtcts


Filip - Puzzle template

Generate code chunks incremenally at pipe

https://www.filipr.com/posts/r-puzzle-template/
Global environment issues?

Beamer template

https://www.filipr.com/posts/beamer-theme/


Cynthia - Combining quarto extension (themes,etc)

https://www.cynthiahqy.com/posts/quarto-extensions-explainer/

Mitch - webr in quarto

https://github.com/mitchelloharawild/quarto-webr-teachr

Janith - Observable

https://janithwanni.quarto.pub/fun-with-ojs/
D3js - blank canvas
Observable Plot: prepared plots for exploratory data analysis
Observable JS

Passing R data to Observable requires transpose
Similar design to ggplot; different syntax
Out of the box interactivity, or very custom beyond ggplot2
https://observablehq.com/@tashapiro
For a comparison of ggplot and observable: https://observablehq.com/@observablehq/plot-from-ggplot2
https://uwdata.github.io/mosaic/what-is-mosaic/


Di - quarto books

Authoring HTML & PDF versions of a textbook in Quarto
HTML ignores latex commands like \index(), .content-visible conditional content based on HTML/PDF - https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/conditional.html
echo-knitr::is_html_output()

title: NUMBAT Hacky hour
text:
If you would like to subscribe to the calendar click here. (Make sure you are logged into your Monash account)




Thursdays (mixed timing) 11AM-12.30PM on NUMBATS Seminar; 1.30-3PM on non-seminar weeks; with virtual option (Zoom Link)



Room 317, Building 6, 29 Ancora Imparo Way (unless indicated otherwise)



Alternating formats Hacky Hour (same as NUMBATS seminar weeks): Shut Up and Code



Show & Tell sessions: Try it out workshops – Mitch masterclasses?



NOT drop-in help session Invitation by regular attendees (regular means?) Software & tools focus
